prompts.prompt: Read the entire email and categorize it into one of the following strictly defined types only: ["spam", "meeting", "newsletter", "task", "update", "other"]. Respond ONLY with the category string and nothing else. Rules: If the email contains suspicious links, lottery, offers → spam. If it requests scheduling, availability, RSVP, meeting details → meeting. If it's periodic like promotions or magazines → newsletter. If it asks the user to complete a task or submit something → task. If it informs progress or deployment → update. Anything else → other.

Extract actionable tasks from the email body. Return ONLY a JSON array of objects, each with 'task' and 'deadline' keys. If there are no tasks, return an empty array []. Example response: [{"task":"Prepare slides for the presentation","deadline":"Before Thursday 10 AM"}]. Be concise and do not include sender greetings or irrelevant lines.

Draft a polite and concise auto-reply for meeting-related emails only. Response structure:
Subject: Re: <original subject>
Body:
Hi <Sender Name>,
Thanks for reaching out. Could you please share the meeting agenda so I can prepare accordingly? I will confirm availability after reviewing the agenda.
Regards,
[Your Name]

If the email is NOT a meeting request, respond with an empty string ''.
